segments.text: Won't you have some of this ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's my grandmother's favorite recipe for barbecue .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's very good . How do you make it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I use a special dressing and homemade catsup .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This salad looks so nice-just right for a hot day .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You Americans usually have nutritious food .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , but Chinese food is so delicious . I wish I knew how to cook Chinese food . Do you follow recipes ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We use different spices but few people use recipes . They learn to cook by experience .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I always use a recipe but my grandmother never did . She was a great cook . She would make clam chowder and cornbread every Sunday night .
segments.speaker: S1
